abstract: Los Angeles joins national debate over police brutality after police chief Charlie Beck joins activists in pressing for charges against Officer Clifford Proctor, who fatally shot Brendon Glenn during an arrest in 2015; decision rests on Dist Atty Jackie Lacey, who has said there is no timetable for her final decision.
lead_paragraph: More than 20 years after Rodney King was beaten, the city has entered a vigorous new debate about the police’s use of force on civilians and minorities.

headline.main: Los Angeles Joins Debate on Force After Police Killing of Homeless Man
headline.print_headline: Los Angeles Joins Debate on Force After Police Killing of a Homeless Man

snippet: More than 20 years after Rodney King was beaten, the city has entered a vigorous new debate about the police’s use of force on civilians and minorities.
